intro: Dyckia glabrifolia, commonly known as the smoothleaf dyckia, is a compact, evergreen bromeliad native to Brazil. It features rosettes of narrow, grass-like leaves that are smooth and glabrous, giving it its common name. The plant produces striking, inflorescences of red or orange flowers that emerge from the center of the rosette. It is drought-tolerant and thrives in full sun to partial shade, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and container planting. Its low maintenance and ornamental value make it a favored plant among succulent and bromeliad enthusiasts.
